message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<jsonArray.length(); i++){
    JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
    while(keys.hasNext()) {
        String key = keys.next();
        JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
        Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
        fruit.setName(key);
        fruit.setValue(values.getString(0));
        fruit.setStock(values.getString(1));
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the keys() method of JSONObject to get an Iterator of the keys in the JSONObject. Then, you can use the next() method of the Iterator to get each key. After getting the key, you can use the getJSONArray() method of JSONObject to get the value of the key, which is a JSONArray. Then, you can use the getString() method of JSONArray to get the value and stock of the fruit. Finally, you can set the name, value, and stock of the fruit using the setName(), setValue(), and setStock() methods of the Fruit class.
